questions.question_text_1: Which of the following is/are NOT typical components of an embedded system?
question_texts: Which of the following is/are NOT typical components of an embedded system?

options.option_text: The data frame uses even parity for error detection.
The data frame uses odd parity for error detection.

questions.question_text_1: What is the main advantage of using flash memory in embedded systems?
question_texts: What is the main advantage of using flash memory in embedded systems?

options.option_text: Retains data even after power loss (non-volatile)

questions.question_text_1: What is the primary purpose of a real-time operating system (RTOS) in an embedded system?
question_texts: What is the primary purpose of a real-time operating system (RTOS) in an embedded system?

options.option_text: To ensure timely and deterministic task execution

questions.question_text_1: Which bitwise operator is used to invert all the bits in a byte?
question_texts: Which bitwise operator is used to invert all the bits in a byte?

questions.question_text_1: How does the CPU interact with memory to perform read and write operations?
question_texts: How does the CPU interact with memory to perform read and write operations?

options.option_text: Through an address and control signals

questions.question_text_1: What is the primary function of an ADC in a microcontroller?
question_texts: What is the primary function of an ADC in a microcontroller?

options.option_text: To convert digital signals into analog signals
To convert analog signals into digital signals
To store digital data in memory

questions.question_text_1: What is a primary use of timers in microcontrollers?
question_texts: What is a primary use of timers in microcontrollers?

options.option_text: To store large amounts of data
To convert analog signals to digital

questions.question_text_1: What is the role of peripherals in an embedded system?
question_texts: What is the role of peripherals in an embedded system?

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following typecasts is needed to assign a void pointer v to an integer pointer p in C?
question_texts: Which of the following typecasts is needed to assign a void pointer v to an integer pointer p in C?

questions.question_text_1: What should be the mask to check if the 3rd index bit (from the right) of a byte x is set to 1? Consider 0-based indexing from right to left.
question_texts: What should be the mask to check if the 3rd index bit (from the right) of a byte x is set to 1? Consider 0-based indexing from right to left.

options.option_text: It sets the pin mode of the LED
It toggles the state of the LED

questions.question_text_1: What is a typical method to generate PWM signals in microcontrollers?
question_texts: What is a typical method to generate PWM signals in microcontrollers?

questions.question_text_1: What is the function of the prescaler in a timer module?
question_texts: What is the function of the prescaler in a timer module?

options.option_text: To divide the input frequency to a lower frequency
To convert digital signals to analog
To generate a reset signal for the microcontroller
